name: bitter

procedures: T1027::[BITTER] has used a RAR SFX dropper to deliver malware.
T1036.004::[BITTER] has disguised malware as a Windows Security update service.
T1053.005::[BITTER] has used scheduled tasks for persistence and execution.
T1068::[BITTER] has exploited CVE-2021-1732 for privilege escalation.
T1071.001::[BITTER] has used HTTP POST requests for C2.
T1095::[BITTER] has used TCP for C2 communications.
T1105::[BITTER] has downloaded additional malware and tools onto a compromised host.
T1203::[BITTER] has exploited Microsoft Office vulnerabilities CVE-2012-0158, CVE-2017-11882, CVE-2018-0798, and CVE-2018-0802.
T1204.002::[BITTER] has attempted to lure victims into opening malicious attachments delivered via spearphishing.
T1559.002::[BITTER] has executed OLE objects using Microsoft Equation Editor to download and run malicious payloads.
T1566.001::[BITTER] has sent spearphishing emails with a malicious RTF document or Excel spreadsheet.
T1568::[BITTER] has used DDNS for C2 communications.
T1573::[BITTER] has encrypted their C2 communications.
T1583.001::[BITTER] has registered a variety of domains to host malicious payloads and for C2.
T1588.002::[BITTER] has obtained tools such as PuTTY for use in their operations.
T1608.001::[BITTER] has registered domains to stage payloads.

description: [BITTER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1002) is a suspected South Asian cyber espionage threat group that has been active since at least 2013. [BITTER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1002) has primarily targeted government, energy, and engineering organizations in Pakistan, China, Bangladesh, and Saudi Arabia.(Citation: Cisco Talos Bitter Bangladesh May 2022)(Citation: Forcepoint BITTER Pakistan Oct 2016)
